quadTree
Class QuadTree<T>

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
          java.awt.Rectangle
              quadTree.QuadTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the values that which will be indexed by points.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class QuadTree<T>
extends java.awt.Rectangle

A general quad tree, a 2D index of point-value pairs which can be queried with a polygon, returning results in O(log(n)) time.

Author:
Curran Kelleher
See Also:
Serialized Form

public QuadTree()

QuadTree

public QuadTree(int x1,
                int y1,
                int x2,
                int y2)
Construct a quadtree node covering the rectangular region specified by the two points: (x1,y1) - the upper left corner, and (x2,y2) - the lower right corner. A default of 5 is used as the threshold for node splitting.

Parameters:
x1 -
y1 -
x2 -
y2 -

public void performSpatialQuery(java.awt.Shape polygon,
                                java.util.List<T> entriesInside)
A recursive function which performs the spacial query

Parameters:
polygon - the polygon to query with
entriesInside - the cumulative list of all entries inside the boundingBox
